description: Trace of Vandermonde matrix of numbers 1,2,..n, i.e. the matrix A with A[i,j] = i^j, 1 <= i <= n, 0 <= j <= n-1.
comments: A member of the family of sequences defined by a(n) = sum_{i=1..n}[i*c(1)*..*c(r)]^(i-1); c(i) integers. Here c(1)=1. - _Ctibor O. Zizka_, Feb 23 2008Partial sum of A000169. The subsequence of prime values begins 3, 701, 45269999, no more through a(50). [From _Jonathan Vos Post_, Feb 12 2010]
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=1,...,100
C. P. Simoes, Teste de Desempenho Mental.
formula: a(n) = sum(k^(k-1), k=1..n)a(n) = SUM[i=1..n] A000169(i). [From _Jonathan Vos Post_, Feb 12 2010]
maple: a:=n->sum ((j+1)^j, j=0..n): seq(a(n), n=0..17);# [From _Zerinvary Lajos_, Dec 17 2008]
prog: (PARI) { for (n=1, 100, write("b060946.txt", n, " ", sum(k=1, n, k^(k - 1))); ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 15 2009]
